result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Junior Lawrence Weiss in court. Attorney Becky N Van Dam in court for Junior Lawrence Weiss. Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached for pleas with counsel free to argue sentence. Def pleads guilty to count #2 and guilty to count #3; def is convicted. Count #1 is dismissed and read in. Argument by counsel on sentence. Statements by defendant. Defendant sentenced.

Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Junior Lawrence Weiss appeared in court. Victim, MMW appears by telephone. Def waives preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and binds defendant over for trial. Defendant referred to State Public Defender and given court appointed attorney paperwork. Victim requesting that no contact provision be lifted. State opposes request. Court modifies bond condition regarding contact.
Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
